content.text: 3 gallons peanut oil for frying, or as needed
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "3 gallons peanut oil for frying, or as needed" )

content.text: 1 (12 pound) whole turkey, neck and giblets removed
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 (12 pound) whole turkey, neck and giblets removed" )

content.text: 0) In a large stockpot or turkey fryer, heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "heat"@40:44 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "oil"@45:48 / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-0-0 "400 degrees F"@52:65 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-0-1 "200 degrees C"@67:80 / TEMPERATURE )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "turkey fryer"@26:38 / TOOL ) 
		:loc ( tool-0-1 "a large stockpot"@6:22 / TOOL )
		:_result ( heated-oil )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Be sure to leave room for the turkey, or the oil will spill over.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "leave"@14:19 / AC
		:ppt ( "room"@20:24 / OTHER )
		:prp ( ing-1 "the turkey"@29:39 / FOOD )
		:todo ( cond-1-0 "or the oil will spill over"@-1:-1 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( oil-in-pan )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Layer a large platter with food-safe paper bags.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "Layer"@3:8 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-2-0 "a large platter"@9:24 / TOOL )
		:instrument ( tool-2-1 "food-safe paper bags"@30:50 / TOOL )
		:_result ( platter-with-bags )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Rinse turkey, and thoroughly pat dry with paper towels.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Rinse"@3:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "turkey"@9:15 / FOOD )
		:_result ( rinsed-turkey )
	)
	:inform ( ac-3-1 "pat"@32:35 / AC
		:ppt ( rinsed-turkey / FOOD )
		:mnr ( "dry"@36:39 / OTHER )
		:instrument ( tool-3-0 "paper towels"@45:57 / TOOL )
		:_result ( dry-turkey )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Rub Creole seasoning over turkey inside and out.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "Rub"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-2 "Creole seasoning"@7:23 / FOOD )
		:gol ( dry-turkey "turkey"@29:35 / FOOD )
		:_result ( rubbed-turkey )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Make sure the hole at the neck is open at least 2 inches so the oil can flow freely through the bird.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( "is"@-1:-1 / COPULA
		:subj ( "the hole at the neck"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:obj ( "open at least 2 inches"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:prp ( purp-5-0 "so the oil can flow freely through the bird"@60:103 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( turkey-with-hole )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Place the whole onion and turkey in drain basket.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "Place"@3:8 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-3 "the whole onion"@9:24 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( turkey-with-hole "turkey"@29:35 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-6-0 "drain basket"@39:51 / TOOL )
		:_result ( onion-turkey-in-basket )
	)
)

content.text: 7) The turkey should be placed in basket neck end first.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "placed"@-1:-1 / AC
		:ppt ( "The turkey"@-1:-1 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-7-0 "basket"@-1:-1 / TOOL )
		:mnr ( "neck end first"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:_result ( placed-turkey )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Slowly lower basket into hot oil to completely cover turkey.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
	:inform ( ac-8-0 "lower"@10:15 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-8-0 "basket"@16:22 / TOOL )
		:gol ( heated-oil "hot oil"@28:35 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-8-0 "to completely cover turkey"@36:62 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( turkey-in-oil )
	)
)

content.text: 9) Maintain the temperature of the oil at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and cook turkey for 3 1/2 minutes per pound, about 45 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Maintain"@-1:-1 / AC
		:ppt ( "the temperature of the oil" / OTHER )
		:heat ( temp-9-0 "350 degrees F"@43:56 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-9-1 "175 degrees C"@58:71 / TEMPERATURE )
		:_result ( maintained-temperature )
	)
	:inform ( ac-9-1 "cook"@78:82 / AC
		:ppt ( turkey-in-oil "turkey"@83:89 / FOOD )
		:duration ( dur-9-0 "3 1/2 minutes per pound"@94:117 / DUR )
		:duration ( dur-9-1 "45 minutes"@125:135 / DUR )
		:_result ( cooked-turkey )
	)
)

content.text: 10) Carefully remove basket from oil, and drain turkey.
content.eamr:
( inst-10 / R
	:inform ( ac-10-0 "remove"@14:20 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-10-0 "basket"@21:27 / TOOL )
		:source ( "oil"@33:36 / FOOD )
		:_result ( turkey-out-oil )
	)
	:inform ( ac-10-1 "drain"@42:47 / AC
		:ppt ( turkey-out-oil "turkey"@48:54 / FOOD )
		:_result ( drained-turkey )
	)
)

content.text: 11) Insert a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the thigh; the internal temperature must be 180 degrees F (80 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "Insert"@4:10 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-11-0 "a meat thermometer"@11:29 / TOOL )
		:gol ( drained-turkey "the thickest part of the thigh"@35:65 / FOOD )
		:_result ( inserted-thermometer )
	)
	:inform ( "must be"@67:91 / COPULA
		:subj ( "the internal temperature"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:obj ( temp-11-0 "180 degrees F"@100:113 / TEMPERATURE )
		:obj ( temp-11-1 "80 degrees C"@115:127 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Finish draining turkey on the prepared platter.
content.eamr:
( inst-12 / R
	:inform ( ac-12-0 "Finish draining"@11:19 / AC
		:ppt ( drained-turkey "turkey"@20:26 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-12-0 "the prepared platter"@30:50 / TOOL )
		:_result ( FINAL_PRODUCT )
	)
)
